author: Robert Glennon
title: ‘Craft’ Beer Turns Out to Be a Big Business
text:
Were Eberhard Anheuser and Adolphus Busch craft brewers when they introduced their lager in 1876? “Craft beer” is not so easy to define. According to the Brewers Association, craft brewers are “small, independent and traditional.” But “small” turns out to mean less than six million barrels, or 186 million gallons, a year. 

Six of the 10 largest U.S. breweries by volume are craft brewers. Sierra Nevada, New Belgium and Deschutes are national brands. The Boston Beer Co., producer of Sam Adams, trades on the New York Stock Exchange...
